newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Forrestania shares up on nickel hopes.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Forrestania shares up on nickel hopes.

text.p: Shares in Forrestania Gold NL surged in early trade on Friday following Thursday's announcement of a substantial resource upgrade at its Maggie Hays nickel project in Western Australia.
By 10.45 a.m. (0045 GMT), Forrestania shares were 39 cents higher at A$2.07 after reaching an intraday high of A$2.25.

Forestania said on Thursday that fresh intersections meant a significant improvement to the Maggie Hays resource, with the company now looking at an expected resource of 11.9 million tonnes at 1.55 percent nickel with production of 16,000 to 18,000 tonnes per annum over a 15 year mine life.

The company said two recent holes returned 50 metres at 2.02 percent nickel, including 6.9 metres of massive sulphides at a grade of 5.17 percent, and 41.2 metres at 1.82 percent nickel, including 5.05 metres of massive sulphides at a grade of 4.66 percent nickel.
"They have gone for a run on the back of that. It is the only fresh information out about the company," said a Sydney broker.
By 11.30 a.m. (0130 GMT), Forrestania shares were 39 cents higher at A$2.07 on turnover of 51,125 shares.
